channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report E-2023100083
item.description:
Report E-2023100083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: SARALAND
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NML experienced a UN3109 TBHP-70-AQ release from a 5-gallon jerrican due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and advised terminal personnel had already conducted cleanup and placed the damaged jug and impacted absorbents into a closed top poly drum. The crew removed the damaged jug from the drum and placed it into a 55-gallon vented poly drum, confirming 1-gallon released. The impacted drum was then cut up and containerized along with the impacted absorbents into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023090580
item.description:
Report X-2023090580

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped by package handler on the way to load it on a van. Upon impact, the package started to leak. Package was put into a hazardous bin and oil-dry was put on to the affected area to soak up the liquid. DescribePack: One of the bottle tops came off inside of the box. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: oil-dry was put on the affected area to soak up the released liquid. Package and cleanup waste was put into a hazardous bin.

item.title: Report E-2023100090
item.description:
Report E-2023100090

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-05T15:12:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel collected one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum of paint and placed in one (1) 85-gallon overpack for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent and absorbent pads to the paint-impacted surfaces and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All paint impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums. RLC personnel took possession of all three (3) drums of waste.
